titleStmt.title: Severall letters of great importance, and good successe lately obtained against the fellowship of Bristow, by Captain William Smith, Captain of His Majesties ship called the Swallow, now in service for the King and Parliament : and likewise the Lord Admiralls design upon Bristoll, and the Navy making ready there under the command of Sir Iohn Pennington.
titleStmt.author: Smith, William, Vice-Admiral.

notesStmt.note: Item at reel 513:20 is identified as S4265 (number cancelled)
Reproduction of original in Bristol Public Library, Bristol, England.
